episodeTitle: Chopper's Fury! The Master's Inhumane Experiment!
description: Chopper discovers the children have been drugged with the addictive stimulant NHC10, causing withdrawal symptoms. Meanwhile, Caesar Clown receives Smoker's heart from Law and sends the Yeti Cool Brothers after the Straw Hats.

events.title: Straw Hats Hide in Cave with Brownbeard
events.description: The Straw Hat Pirates and the children take shelter in a cave on Punk Hazard with a captured Brownbeard, who provides information about the Master.
events.significance: Establishes the temporary refuge location where Chopper will make his critical discovery about the children's condition.

events.title: Zoro, Sanji, and Brook Search for Kin'emon
events.description: Zoro, Sanji, and Brook leave the cave to search for the samurai Kin'emon, specifically looking for his torso after previously finding his legs.
events.significance: Separates these crew members from the group, setting them up to encounter the Yeti Cool Brothers.

events.title: Children Reveal They Were Normal Sized
events.description: The giant children reveal to the Straw Hats that none of them were actually giants when they arrived on the island. They were all normal-sized children who have been growing progressively larger during their time on Punk Hazard.
events.significance: Critical revelation that exposes the true nature of Caesar Clown's experiments and the children's transformation.

quotes.text: None of us were giants. We were all normal size when we first came to the island.
quotes.speaker: Sind
quotes.context: Revealing the truth about their condition to the Straw Hats

events.title: Chopper Theorizes About Pituitary Hormone Growth
events.description: Chopper concludes that the children's rapid growth came from experiments that artificially increased the levels of their pituitary hormones, causing abnormal gigantification.
events.significance: Explains the scientific mechanism behind Caesar's experiments and demonstrates Chopper's medical expertise.

quotes.text: The rapid growth came from experiments that increased the levels of their pituitary hormone.
quotes.speaker: Chopper
quotes.context: Explaining the medical basis for the children's gigantification

events.title: Children Begin Withdrawal Symptoms
events.description: The giant children suddenly begin falling over in severe pain, crying out for candy with bloodshot eyes, runny noses, and drooling. Their bodies are experiencing violent withdrawal symptoms from the drug NHC10.
events.significance: The pivotal moment that reveals the true horror of Caesar's experiments and triggers Chopper's investigation.

quotes.speaker: Sind
quotes.context: Begging for the drug-laced candy during withdrawal

events.title: Chopper Discovers NHC10 Drug Addiction
events.description: After examining the children, Chopper reveals they have been given NHC10, a powerful and highly addictive stimulant whose use is tightly restricted throughout the world. The children were unknowingly addicted through candy given to them daily, keeping them trapped at the facility.
events.significance: Exposes the darkest aspect of Caesar Clown's experiments - he deliberately addicted kidnapped children to control them. This is one of the most morally reprehensible acts in the Punk Hazard arc.

quotes.text: They've been given NHC10, a powerful stimulant. The use of which is tightly restricted throughout the world due to the danger it comes with!
quotes.speaker: Chopper
quotes.context: Revealing his diagnosis of the children's condition

quotes.text: The children aren't sick! They're suffering from drug withdrawal!
quotes.speaker: Chopper
quotes.context: Angrily confronting the truth about the Master's experiments

events.title: Chopper's Fury at Caesar's Inhumanity
events.description: Chopper becomes enraged upon discovering the children were kidnapped and experimented on. He expresses his desire to save them and return them to their parents, while demanding revenge against the Master for his crimes.
events.significance: Character-defining moment showing Chopper's moral conviction as a doctor and his compassion for the innocent. Demonstrates the Straw Hats' core values.

quotes.text: We have to save these children and return them to their parents! I won't forgive the Master for this!
quotes.speaker: Chopper
quotes.context: Expressing his determination to help the children

events.title: Chopper Refuses to Give Children the Drug
events.description: Despite the children's desperate pleas and suffering, Chopper refuses to provide them with the drug candy, knowing it would only perpetuate their addiction and imprisonment.
events.significance: Shows Chopper making a difficult medical decision, choosing long-term wellbeing over immediate comfort, despite how much it pains him.

events.title: Addicted Children Attack the Straw Hats
events.description: The children, driven mad by withdrawal symptoms, attack the Straw Hat Pirates in a desperate attempt to get candy. The Straw Hats struggle to defend themselves without hurting the children.
events.significance: Forces the Straw Hats into an impossible situation where they must protect themselves from victims they're trying to save, highlighting the cruelty of Caesar's experiments.

events.title: Usopp Uses Bakusui Boshi to Sedate Children
events.description: Usopp deploys his Bakusui Boshi (Sleeping Star) technique, shooting a pellet that releases a powerful sleeping gas to peacefully sedate the berserk children without harming them.
events.significance: First use of this technique in the series. Provides a non-violent solution to the crisis and shows Usopp's tactical thinking.

quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Deploying his sleeping star attack to sedate the children

events.title: Law Gives Smoker's Heart to Caesar
events.description: In Caesar's research facility, Trafalgar Law hands over Smoker's heart to Caesar Clown, despite showing visible displeasure at his actions. Caesar holds the Vice Admiral's heart in his hand.
events.significance: Major strategic move that gives Caesar leverage over a powerful Marine officer. Demonstrates Law's commitment to his alliance with Caesar while hinting at his inner conflict.

events.title: Yeti Cool Brothers Introduced
events.description: Caesar Clown dispatches the Yeti Cool Brothers, a pair of mysterious assassin brothers named Rock and Scotch, to eliminate the Straw Hat Pirates. They are described as deadly killers who will murder anyone for the right price.
events.significance: Introduction of new antagonists who will pose a significant threat to the Straw Hats in upcoming episodes.

quotes.text: Yeti Cool Brothers, eliminate the Straw Hats!
quotes.speaker: Caesar Clown

events.title: Zoro, Sanji, and Brook Found Unconscious
events.description: The episode ends with Zoro, Sanji, and Brook discovered unconscious in the snow, surrounded by gigantic footprints. They have been defeated by an unknown enemy.
events.significance: Cliffhanger ending that establishes the Yeti Cool Brothers as a serious threat capable of defeating even the Monster Trio members. Creates tension for the next episode.

themes.description: The episode explores Chopper's role as a doctor facing a moral crisis. He must make the difficult decision to withhold addictive drugs from suffering children, knowing it's the right long-term choice despite the immediate pain it causes.
themes.symbolism: Chopper's fury represents the righteous anger of a healer confronted with deliberate harm inflicted on the innocent.

themes.description: Caesar Clown's experiments represent one of the darkest villain acts in One Piece - kidnapping children, experimenting on their bodies, and deliberately addicting them to maintain control.
themes.symbolism: The candy serves as a dark symbol of manipulation, taking something innocent and turning it into a tool of enslavement.

themes.description: The episode contrasts Chopper's ethical medical practice with Caesar's amoral scientific experimentation, highlighting the importance of using scientific knowledge for good rather than evil.
themes.symbolism: The laboratory setting represents the corruption of science when divorced from ethics and humanity.

characterSpotlights.role: Protagonist - Medical Detective and Moral Compass
characterSpotlights.development: This episode showcases Chopper's growth as a doctor and his moral conviction. His medical expertise allows him to diagnose the children's addiction, while his compassion drives his fury at Caesar's crimes. His refusal to enable the children's addiction, despite their suffering, shows professional integrity.

mangaDifferences.difference: Episode 591 adapted only pages 2-17 of Chapter 665, extending the manga content with additional reaction shots and dialogue.
The anime extended scenes of the children's withdrawal symptoms with additional visual effects and longer duration to emphasize the horror of the situation.

trivia.fact: This is the first episode to use 'Hands Up!' by Kōta Shinzato as the opening theme, replacing 'We Go!' which had been used since episode 517.
Episode 591 aired on April 14, 2013 in Japan but was simulcast on April 13, 2013 for international audiences, one day earlier.
NHC10 is an anime-original name for the drug. In the manga, the specific drug name is not mentioned, only that it's a powerful stimulant.
The Yeti Cool Brothers make their first appearance in this episode, though they are not fully seen until later episodes.
